(Note by the Secretary).I am informed "by the Board of Trade that in accordance wiih the decision reached at yesterday1s War Cabinet (War Cabinet 226, Minute 10) a Meeting Y/as held to-day with representatives of the Associated Society, who were informed by the Railway Executive Committee that their war bonus would be converted into war wages but that there would be no increase of 3/6d. a day war wage, for \vhich they had asked.Upon receiving this information the men said that they had been tricked and have now gone away for reasons which the Board of Trade do not know, either for the purpose of conferring or possibly in order to make trouble.In these circumstances the Home Office and Scotland Yard have been warned. Sir A, Stanley is away at Harrogate, but is being notified immediately.(Signed) M. P. A, HAH KEY.Secretary.2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W. Slst' August, 1917.
